meanings.definition: To formulate or plan in advance.
meanings.sent1: She preformulates her study schedule every Sunday night.
meanings.sent2: He always preformulates his speeches before giving them.
meanings.sent3: The student preformulates a strategy to ace the exam.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled chess player, she preformulates her moves in advance.
meanings.sent5: His habit of preformulating decisions helps him stay organized.

meanings.sent1: The artist preformulates the clay before starting to sculpt.
meanings.sent2: Before baking, she preformulates the dough into perfect shapes.
meanings.sent3: The chef preformulates the ingredients into a masterpiece dish.
meanings.sent4: The architect preformulates the design in intricate detail.
meanings.sent5: The tailor preformulates the fabric before sewing it into a garment.
